Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "update readme for .Net foundation requirements" (#1194) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Opened issue "Feature request: SAX Approach addition of ReadLastChild() function for OpenXmlReader" (#1193) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
**Suggestion**
There are three SAX options to read from a spreadsheet document e.g.
- Read()
- ReadFirstChild()
- ReadNextSibling()

Please can this be extended to include **ReadLastChild()** which will move the SAX reader straight to the Last Child Element of the node?

**Current situation**
When using the DOM approach we can easily sort by Descending or take the LastChild from the element collection.

With the SAX approach, the reader must iterate through all preceeding Cells or Rows using reader.ReadNextSibling and checking if reader.IsEndElement before the last element can be loaded using the reader.LoadCurrentElement();

It would be faster if when ReadLastChild() is used the OpenXmlReader's position is moved immediately to the last child Element of the node whether it is a Row or Cell type.

The SAX reader is used for large Excel document's and this will reduce processing speed in these instances.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Fix roadmap links" (#1192) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Closed issue "Add support for XLOOKUP formula in OpenXML SDK" (#1189) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
** Description **
Please add support for XLOOKUP formula parsing and calculation in Strict Open XML XLSX file output

**Information**

- .NET Target: All
- DocumentFormat.OpenXml Version: 2.17.1

**Repro**

```csharp
Example formula
=XLOOKUP(A1, A3:A5, B3:B5)
``` 

**Observed**

Lookup is not calculated in XLSX output
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9335220/182652778-67aef7a4-963b-44ce-ab7a-d271b92ca1e0.png)


**Expected**

Support for formula syntax
=XLOOKUP(lookup_value, lookup_array, return_array, [if_not_found], [match_mode], [search_mode])
